string_table.string: Use the w, a, s, and d keys to move around the 360 degree image. Press the tab key to jump to interactive markers and hotspots.
Closed captions. Press the spacebar to toggle captions on and off.
Skip Navigation. Hit enter to return to the slide.
To preview this video, use the Preview functionality in Storyline, republish your course using standard MP4 video, or publish to Review 360.
Streaming video is unavailable for local playback.

slidelink.displaytext: Section 1: What Are the Social Determinants of Health?

resource_data.description: Here are some useful links and documents:

slidetranscripts.slidetranscript:
<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Style FlowDirection="LeftToRight" LeadingMargin="0" TrailingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="0" Justification="Left" LineSpacingRule="Multiple" LineSpacing="23" SpacingBefore="12" SpacingAfter="12"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Parentheses" Color="#000000" BulletFont="Arial" /> </Style> <Span Text="Narration: Now we’ll hear from Jessica again, reflecting on how upstream and midstream social determinants of health impacted the family that she was working with. For a summary of the case so far, click the information button at the bottom of your screen. [after video] Can you think of any experiences that you’ve had as a provider where factors upstream had a significant downstream impact on the health and wellbeing of the individual or individuals you were working with?
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style FlowDirection="LeftToRight" LeadingMargin="0" TrailingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="0" Justification="Left" LineSpacingRule="Multiple" LineSpacing="23" SpacingBefore="12" SpacingAfter="12"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Parentheses" Color="#000000" BulletFont="Arial" /> </Style> <Span Text="Video: As we got to know the mom and child, we learned how important it was to remain curious and open with our questions. we learned there were several Social Determinants of Health issues impacting the family. This included: Economic (in)Stability: economic instability, poverty, lack of access to health foods; Education: early childhood education lack of education and educational disparities for Mom; Social, Family, and Community: lack of family/community support, stress and trauma, stigma and Discrimination; and, Neighborhood and Environment: Substandard housing, exposure to crime, violence. Some of these experiences were “Upstream” while others were “Midstream,” but they all had significant “Downstream” impacts. For instance, Mom had experienced discrimination against her intellectual functioning, lacked educational support growing up, struggled to find a job, and once she was employed as an adult, was employed in a minimum wage position which left the family in poverty. While the family was able to have reduced housing costs through an affordable housing program, their living conditions were substandard (and unsafe Mom often verbalized feeling unsafe playing outside with her little one because of the neighborhood and gang violence, and she also verbalized feeling judged by her neighbors for being “not as smart,” as they were. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style FlowDirection="LeftToRight" LeadingMargin="0" TrailingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="0" Justification="Left" LineSpacingRule="Multiple" LineSpacing="23" SpacingBefore="12" SpacingAfter="12"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Parentheses" Color="#000000" BulletFont="Arial" /> </Style> <Span Text="We knew these experiences also lead to greater stress and trauma for the Mom and her child, as well as ongoing stigmatization and discrimination. The way these issues compounded was really upsetting. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style FlowDirection="LeftToRight" LeadingMargin="0" TrailingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="0" Justification="Left" LineSpacingRule="Multiple" LineSpacing="23" SpacingBefore="12" SpacingAfter="12"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Parentheses" Color="#000000" BulletFont="Arial" /> </Style> <Span Text="The focus of our work to support Mom in addressing some of these atrocities was advocacy, care coordination, and ongoing trauma treatment. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style FlowDirection="LeftToRight" LeadingMargin="0" TrailingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="0" Justification="Left" LineSpacingRule="Multiple" LineSpacing="23" SpacingBefore="12" SpacingAfter="12"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Parentheses" Color="#000000" BulletFont="Arial" /> </Style> <Span Text="In addition to following Mom’s lead in terms of actions to take, we also had to work to encourage and empower her. After experiencing discrimination on many fronts, Mom could become discouraged at barriers quickly. It was important to recognize and validate her experience and advocate for her needs to help facilitate changes. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style FlowDirection="LeftToRight" LeadingMargin="0" TrailingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="0" Justification="Left" LineSpacingRule="Multiple" LineSpacing="23" SpacingBefore="12" SpacingAfter="12"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Parentheses" BulletFont="Arial" /> </Style> <Span Text="This took place in the context of connecting Mom to alternate housing programs, obtaining pest control supporting her with job searches and resources for employment, and helping her advocate for her child’s educational needs at ongoing Pre-K and IEP meetings. Throughout our work with this family, Mom showcased her strengths and determination to make positive changes for herself and her child. " /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Style FlowDirection="LeftToRight" LeadingMargin="0" TrailingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="0" Justification="Left" LineSpacingRule="Multiple" LineSpacing="23" SpacingBefore="12" SpacingAfter="12"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Parentheses" Color="#000000" BulletFont="Arial" /> </Style> <Span Text="Narration: Click the play button to hear the first part of Jessica’s story from the Intersectionality module." /> </Block> </Content> </Document>
